subject: Communication
title: Cold War Information Warfare
description: A 60-second lesson on Cold War Information Warfare.

hook.text: The CIA funded abstract art exhibitions. The KGB planted fake news in African newspapers.

buildup.text: Both superpowers built massive propaganda machines: Voice of America vs.

discovery.text: The CIA's Operation Mockingbird placed agents inside major news organizations to influence coverage.

twist.text: Soviet 'dezinformatsiya' (disinformation) was so effective that the playbook is still used today ‚Äî with social media.

climax.text: The Cold War proved that controlling the narrative can be as powerful as controlling territory. Information is a weapon.

punchline.text: The most dangerous weapon in the Cold War wasn't nuclear. It was narrative.
